vcd-inserted-media.body:
resource "vcd_inserted_media" "$1" {
    # vm_name - (Required) - The name of VM to be used to insert media file
    vm_name = ""

    # vapp_name - (Required) - The name of vApp to find
    vapp_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Media file name in catalog which will be inserted to VM
    name = ""

    # catalog - (Required) The name of the catalog where to find media file
    catalog = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-inserted-media.description: Provides a vCloud Director resource for inserting or ejecting media (ISO) file for the VM. Create this resource for inserting the media, and destroy it for ejecting. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-catalog.body:
resource "vcd_catalog" "$1" {
    # delete_force - (Required) - When destroying use delete_force=True with delete_recursive=True to remove a catalog and any objects it contains, regardless of their state
    delete_force = ""

    # delete_recursive - (Required) - When destroying use delete_recursive=True to remove the catalog and any objects it contains that are in a state that normally allows removal
    delete_recursive = ""

    # name - (Required) Catalog name
    name = ""

    # org - (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # description - (Optional) - Description of catalog
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-catalog.description: Provides a vCloud Director catalog resource. This can be used to create and delete a catalog. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-catalog-item.body:
resource "vcd_catalog_item" "$1" {
    # ova_path - (Required) - Absolute or relative path to file to upload
    ova_path = ""

    # name - (Required) Item name in catalog
    name = ""

    # catalog - (Required) The name of the catalog where to upload OVA file
    catalog = ""

    # org - (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # description - (Optional) - Description of item
    description = ""

    # upload_piece_size - (Optional) - Size in MB for splitting upload size. It can possibly impact upload performance. Default 1MB.
    upload_piece_size = ""

    # show_upload_progress - (Optional) - Default false. Allows to see upload progress
    show_upload_progress = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-catalog-item.description: Provides a vCloud Director catalog item resource. This can be used to upload OVA to catalog and delete it. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-catalog-media.body:
resource "vcd_catalog_media" "$1" {
    # media_path - (Required) - Absolute or relative path to file to upload
    media_path = ""

    # name - (Required) Media file name in catalog
    name = ""

    # catalog - (Required) The name of the catalog where to upload media file
    catalog = ""

    # org - (Optional) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # description - (Optional) - Description of media file
    description = ""

    # upload_piece_size - (Optional) - size in MB for splitting upload size. It can possibly impact upload performance. Default 1MB.
    upload_piece_size = ""

    # show_upload_progress - (Optional) - Default false. Allows to see upload progress
    show_upload_progress = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-catalog-media.description: Provides a vCloud Director media resource. This can be used to upload media to catalog and delete it. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-dnat.body:
resource "vcd_dnat" "$1" {
    # internal_ip - (Required) The IP of the VM to map to
    internal_ip = ""

    # port - (Required) The port number to map. -1 translates to "any"
    port = ""

    # external_ip - (Required) One of the external IPs available on your Edge Gateway
    external_ip = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the DNAT
    edge_gateway = ""

    # translated_port - (Optional) The port number to map
    translated_port = ""

    # protocol - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The protocol type. Possible values are TCP, UDP, TCPUDP, ICMP, ANY. TCP is default to be backward compatible with previous version
    protocol = ""

    # icmp_sub_type - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of ICMP type. Possible values are   address-mask-request, destination-unreachable, echo-request, echo-reply, parameter-problem, redirect, router-advertisement, router-solicitation, source-quench, time-exceeded, timestamp-request, timestamp-reply, any
    icmp_sub_type = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-dnat.description:
Provides a vCloud Director DNAT resource. This can be used to create, modify,
and delete destination NATs to map an external IP/port to an internal IP/port.

vcd-resource-edgegateway-vpn.body:
resource "vcd_edgegateway_vpn" "$1" {
    # peer_subnets - (Required) - List of Peer Subnets see [Peer Subnets](#peersubnets) below for details.
    peer_subnets = ""

    # local_subnets - (Required) - List of Local Subnets see [Local Subnets](#localsubnets) below for details.
    local_subnets = ""

    # shared_secret - (Required) - Shared Secret
    shared_secret = ""

    # peer_id - (Required) - Peer ID
    peer_id = ""

    # peer_ip_address - (Required) - Peer IP Address
    peer_ip_address = ""

    # mtu - (Required) - The MTU setting
    mtu = ""

    # local_id - (Required) - Local ID
    local_id = ""

    # local_ip_address - (Required) - Local IP Address
    local_ip_address = ""

    # encryption_protocol - (Required) - E.g. `AES256`
    encryption_protocol = ""

    # description - (Required) A description for the VPN
    description = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the VPN 
    name = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the Firewall Rules
    edge_gateway = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-edgegateway-vpn.description:
Provides a vCloud Director IPsec VPN. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete VPN settings and rules.

vcd-resource-firewall-rules.body:
resource "vcd_firewall_rules" "$1" {
    # default_action - (Required) Either "allow" or "deny". Specifies what to do should none of the rules match
    default_action = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the Firewall Rules
    edge_gateway = ""

    # rule - (Optional) Configures a firewall rule; see [Rules](#rules) below for details.
    rule = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-firewall-rules.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Firewall resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete firewall settings and rules.

vcd-resource-network.body:
resource "vcd_network" "$1" {
    # gateway - (Required) The gateway for this network
    gateway = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway
    edge_gateway = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the network
    name = ""

    # netmask - (Optional) The netmask for the new network. Defaults to `255.255.255.0`
    netmask = ""

    # dns_suffix - (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network
    dns_suffix = ""

    # shared - (Optional) Defines if this network is shared between multiple vDCs
    shared = ""

    # dhcp_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs to issue to virtual machines that don't
    dhcp_pool = ""

    # static_ip_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs permitted to be used as static IPs for
    static_ip_pool = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-network.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Org VDC Network. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete internal networks for vApps to connect. **Deprecated in v2.0+** : this resource is deprecated and replaced by [vcd-network-routed](network_routed.html).
It is also complemented by [vcd-network-isolated](network_isolated.html) and [vcd-network-direct](network_direct.html).

vcd-resource-network-direct.body:
resource "vcd_network_direct" "$1" {
    # external_network - (Required) The name of the external network.
    external_network = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the network
    name = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when 
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # shared - (Optional) Defines if this network is shared between multiple vDCs
    shared = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-network-direct.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Org VDC Network directly connected to an external network. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete internal networks for vApps to connect. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-network-isolated.body:
resource "vcd_network_isolated" "$1" {
    # gateway - (Required) The gateway for this network
    gateway = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the network
    name = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when 
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # netmask - (Optional) The netmask for the new network. Defaults to `255.255.255.0`
    netmask = ""

    # dns_suffix - (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network
    dns_suffix = ""

    # shared - (Optional) Defines if this network is shared between multiple vDCs
    shared = ""

    # dhcp_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs to issue to virtual machines that don't
    dhcp_pool = ""

    # static_ip_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs permitted to be used as static IPs for
    static_ip_pool = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-network-isolated.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Org VDC isolated Network. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete internal networks for vApps to connect. This network is not attached to external networks or routers. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-network-routed.body:
resource "vcd_network_routed" "$1" {
    # gateway - (Required) The gateway for this network
    gateway = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway
    edge_gateway = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the network
    name = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when 
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # netmask - (Optional) The netmask for the new network. Defaults to `255.255.255.0`
    netmask = ""

    # dns_suffix - (Optional) A FQDN for the virtual machines on this network
    dns_suffix = ""

    # shared - (Optional) Defines if this network is shared between multiple vDCs
    shared = ""

    # dhcp_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs to issue to virtual machines that don't
    dhcp_pool = ""

    # static_ip_pool - (Optional) A range of IPs permitted to be used as static IPs for
    static_ip_pool = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-network-routed.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Org VDC routed Network. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete internal networks for vApps to connect. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-org.body:
resource "vcd_org" "$1" {
    # delete_force - (Required) - pass `delete_force=true` and `delete_recursive=true` to remove an organization or VDC and any objects it contains, regardless of their state.
    delete_force = ""

    # delete_recursive - (Required) - pass `delete_recursive`=true as query parameter to remove an organization or VDC and any objects it contains that are in a state that normally allows removal.
    delete_recursive = ""

    # full_name - (Required) Org full name
    full_name = ""

    # name - (Required) Org name
    name = ""

    # is_enabled - (Optional) - True if this organization is enabled (allows login and all other operations). Default is `true`.
    is_enabled = ""

    # description - (Optional) - Org description. Default is empty.
    description = ""

    # deployed_vm_quota - (Optional) - Maximum number of virtual machines that can be deployed simultaneously by a member of this organization. Default is unlimited (-1)
    deployed_vm_quota = ""

    # stored_vm_quota - (Optional) - Maximum number of virtual machines in vApps or vApp templates that can be stored in an undeployed state by a member of this organization. Default is unlimited (-1)
    stored_vm_quota = ""

    # can_publish_catalogs - (Optional) - True if this organization is allowed to share catalogs. Default is `true`.
    can_publish_catalogs = ""

    # delay_after_power_on_seconds - (Optional) - Specifies this organization's default for virtual machine boot delay after power on. Default is `0`.
    delay_after_power_on_seconds = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-org.description:
Provides a vCloud Director Org resource. This can be used to create and delete an organization.
Requires system administrator privileges. Supported in provider *v2.0+*

vcd-resource-snat.body:
resource "vcd_snat" "$1" {
    # internal_ip - (Required) The IP or IP Range of the VM(s) to map from
    internal_ip = ""

    # external_ip - (Required) One of the external IPs available on your Edge Gateway
    external_ip = ""

    # edge_gateway - (Required) The name of the edge gateway on which to apply the SNAT
    edge_gateway = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-snat.description:
Provides a vCloud Director SNAT resource. This can be used to create, modify,
and delete source NATs to allow vApps to send external traffic.

vcd-resource-vapp.body:
resource "vcd_vapp" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) A unique name for the vApp
    name = ""

    # catalog_name - (Optional) The catalog name in which to find the given vApp Template
    catalog_name = ""

    # template_name - (Optional) The name of the vApp Template to use
    template_name = ""

    # memory - (Optional) The amount of RAM (in MB) to allocate to the vApp
    memory = ""

    # cpus - (Optional) The number of virtual CPUs to allocate to the vApp
    cpus = ""

    # initscript - (Optional) A script to be run only on initial boot
    initscript = ""

    # network_name - (Optional) Name of the network this vApp should join
    network_name = ""

    # network_href - (Optional) (Deprecated) The vCloud Director generated href of the network this vApp
    network_href = ""

    # ip - (Optional) The IP to assign to this vApp. Must be an IP address or
    ip = ""

    # static_ip_pool - (Optional) `static_ip_pool` set for the network. If left blank, and the network has
    static_ip_pool = ""

    # dhcp_pool - (Optional) `dhcp_pool` set with at least one available IP then this will be set with
    dhcp_pool = ""

    # metadata - (Optional) Key value map of metadata to assign to this vApp
    metadata = ""

    # ovf - (Optional) Key value map of ovf parameters to assign to VM product section
    ovf = ""

    # power_on - (Optional) A boolean value stating if this vApp should be powered on. Default is `true`
    power_on = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # accept_all_eulas - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) Automatically accept EULA if OVA has it. Default is `true`
    accept_all_eulas = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-vapp.description:
Provides a vCloud Director vApp resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete vApps.

vcd-resource-vapp-vm.body:
resource "vcd_vapp_vm" "$1" {
    # template_name - (Required) The name of the vApp Template to use
    template_name = ""

    # catalog_name - (Required) The catalog name in which to find the given vApp Template
    catalog_name = ""

    # name - (Required) A unique name for the vApp
    name = ""

    # vapp_name - (Required) The vApp this VM should belong to.
    vapp_name = ""

    # memory - (Optional) The amount of RAM (in MB) to allocate to the vApp
    memory = ""

    # cpus - (Optional) The number of virtual CPUs to allocate to the vApp
    cpus = ""

    # initscript - (Optional) A script to be run only on initial boot
    initscript = ""

    # network_name - (Optional) Name of the network this VM should connect to
    network_name = ""

    # ip - (Optional) The IP to assign to this vApp. Must be an IP address or
    ip = ""

    # static_ip_pool - (Optional) `static_ip_pool` set for the network. If left blank, and the network has
    static_ip_pool = ""

    # dhcp_pool - (Optional) `dhcp_pool` set with at least one available IP then this will be set with
    dhcp_pool = ""

    # power_on - (Optional) A boolean value stating if this vApp should be powered on. Default is `true`
    power_on = ""

    # accept_all_eulas - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) Automatically accept EULA if OVA has it. Default is `true`
    accept_all_eulas = ""

    # org - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of organization to use, optional if defined at provider level. Useful when connected as sysadmin working across different organisations
    org = ""

    # vdc - (Optional) (Optional; *v2.0+*) The name of VDC to use, optional if defined at provider level
    vdc = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
vcd-resource-vapp-vm.description:
Provides a vCloud Director VM resource. This can be used to create,
modify, and delete VMs within a vApp. ~> **Note:** To make sure resources are created in the right order and both plan apply and destroy succeeds, use the `depends_on` clause (see example below)
